Html: Mac OS 10.5; FF and Safari.  I managed to break the item cache for several items in both browsers because of an armory parsing bug, and as resetting the item cache doesn't seem to be implemented yet, I'd like to nuke the cache data on my machine so I can get the "good" cache data again.  Resetting my web browser doesn't seem to have any effect, so I'm assuming this data is stored locally elsewhere.  Any suggestions as to where to look?

Right click anywhere, goto Silverlight.... Leave that dialog open. Close Rawr3 completely. Once Rawr3 is completely closed, goto the Application Storage tab of that dialog, and click Delete All.

(If you delete it, then close Rawr3, it'll resave the current data into the application storage on close)
